column1: FMEA Worksheet - Equipment Failure Mode and Effects Analysis

column3: Sudden failure causing injury, death, or environmental catastrophe without warning
Failure causing injury, death, or environmental catastrophe with warning
Equipment destroyed, major production loss (>1 week), regulatory violation
Major equipment damage, significant production loss (days), safety system impaired
Moderate equipment damage, production loss (8-24 hours), quality affected
Minor equipment damage, production loss (4-8 hours)
Cosmetic damage, minor production impact (<4 hours)
No known controls, failure not detectable
Very low chance of detection (annual inspection only)
Moderate chance of detection (monthly inspection + basic monitoring)
Moderately high chance (weekly checks + trend analysis)
High chance of detection (continuous monitoring with alerts)
Stop operation if safe to do so. Implement corrective action immediately.
Plan corrective action within 1 week. Increase monitoring.
Schedule corrective action within 1 month. Review during next PM.
Address during next scheduled maintenance window.
No immediate action required. Review during annual FMEA update.

column1: 1. Fill in header information (company, equipment, date, team)
2. List each component in the Equipment/Component column
3. Define the function of each component
4. Identify potential failure modes (how it could fail)
5. Describe effects at local level and system level
6. Identify root causes for each failure mode
7. Rate Severity (S), Occurrence (O), and Detection (D) using the scales above
8. Calculate RPN = S x O x D
9. Prioritize actions based on RPN and severity
10. Assign owners and target dates for high-priority items
11. After implementing actions, re-score and calculate new RPN
12. Review and update FMEA at least annually
